headline: Federal Realty (FRT): One-Off Gain Boosts Profit Margin, Raising Questions on Earnings Quality
summary: Federal Realty Investment Trust (FRT) posted net profit margins of 27.2%, up from last year’s 24%, with EPS growth of 20.1% for the year. This beats its 5-year average of 11.8% per year. These latest earnings included a notable $79.4 million one-off gain, which helped boost profitability. With shares trading at a Price-to-Earnings ratio of 24.6x, which is below the US Retail REITs sector average and its peers, and an estimated fair value of $133.35 per share versus the market price of $96.19,...
